DOC.brief_summary: Hypofractionated radiosurgery has been investigated in a few trials and appears to be safe and feasible. Investigators initiated this multicenter phase II prospective trial to analyse feasibility (toxicity) of hypofractionated radiosurgery with 5 fractions in patients with localised prostate cancer, who are ineligible for the "PREFERE trial" under the hypothesis that the ratio of patients with late toxicity ≥ grade 2 after 1 year amounts 2,8% and is significant lower than 17.5%.
DOC.brief_title: Hypofractionated Radiosurgery for Localised Prostate Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: Experimental radiosurgery of prostate with 5 fractions each with 7,00 Gy (total application rate of 35,00 Gy). Planned visits are: Baseline, visits at every radiation day and four follow ups (4-6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months and one year after last day of radiation).
DOC.criteria: Localised, histopathologically confirmed Prostate Cancer (cT13 N0 M0) Gleasongrade ≤7 Guidelinebased staging Age >75 years or Age 7075 years and either PSA > 10 ng/ml and/or GleasonScore 7b and/or GleasonScore 7a with >33 % of the taken punches positve and/or cT >2a and/or prostate volume >60 cm³ PSA < 15 ng/ml Volume of the prostate <80 cm³ IPSSScore ≤12 Written informed consent Indication for treatment within the PREFERE trial History of prior pelvic radiotherapy Contraindication to Fiducial marker implantation (e.g. allergy to gold), Immunosuppressive therapy Relevant comorbidity thought to adversely affect treatment compliance, Legal incapacity or lack of informed consent
